phonetic american: tɜːrn bæk ðə hændz əv taɪm
phonetic british: tɜːn bæk ðə hændz əv taɪm

meaning list.meaning: At vende tilbage til fortiden eller skrue tiden tilbage (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: If I could turn back the hands of time, I’d make a different decision.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hvis jeg kunne skrue tiden tilbage, ville jeg have truffet en anden beslutning.

meaning list.sentence: He never went to college but learned everything from the university of life.
meaning list.sentence translation: Han gik ikke på universitetet, men han lærte alt af livet.

meaning list.sentence: You can wait until hell freezes over, but I won’t change my mind.
meaning list.sentence translation: Du kan vente for evigt, men jeg vil ikke ændre mening.

meaning list.meaning: noget går til spilde eller fejler (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: All our hard work went up in smoke when the project was canceled.
meaning list.sentence translation: Alt vores hårde arbejde gik i vasken, da projektet blev aflyst.

meaning list.meaning: venter på en mulighed, bliver forberedt (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: She’s waiting in the wings for a chance to prove herself.
meaning list.sentence translation: Han venter på en mulighed for at bevise sig selv.

meaning list.sentence: He walked out on his family when things got tough.
meaning list.sentence translation: Da tingene blev svære, forlod han sin familie.

meaning list.sentence: We’re wasting time discussing irrelevant issues.
meaning list.sentence translation: Vi spilder tid på at diskutere irrelevante emner.

meaning list.meaning: System eller gruppe, der kører problemfrit (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The team works like a well-oiled machine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Teamet fungerer som et velfungerende system.

meaning list.sentence: We had a whale of a time at the amusement park.
meaning list.sentence translation: Vi havde en fantastisk tid i forlystelsesparken.

meaning list.meaning: At være meget bleg af frygt eller sygdom (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He turned white as a sheet when he heard the news.
meaning list.sentence translation: Han blev bleg, da han hørte nyheden.

meaning list.meaning: kontormedarbejder, person, der udfører mentalt arbejde (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: White-collar jobs are becoming more common in urban areas.
meaning list.sentence translation: Funktionærjob bliver mere almindelige i byområder.

meaning list.meaning: Noget, der koster for meget, men er ubrugeligt (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The stadium turned out to be a white elephant for the city.
meaning list.sentence translation: Stadionet viste sig at være en dyr, men ubrugelig investering for byen.

meaning list.sentence: She told a white lie to avoid hurting his feelings.
meaning list.sentence translation: Han fortalte en lille løgn for at undgå at såre hendes følelser.

meaning list.meaning: at dække over en fejl eller fejl (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: The company tried to whitewash the scandal.
meaning list.sentence translation: Virksomheden forsøgte at dække over skandalen.

meaning list.sentence: When they throw a party, they go the whole nine yards with decorations and food.
meaning list.sentence translation: Når de holder fest, går de helt ud med pynt og mad.

meaning list.sentence: I’ll be at your party with bells on!
meaning list.sentence translation: Jeg kommer til din fest med stor spænding!

meaning list.meaning: Præmie eller titel givet til den person, der kommer sidst (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: They were awarded the wooden spoon for finishing last in the league.
meaning list.sentence translation: De modtog træske-prisen for at ligge sidst i ligaen.

meaning list.sentence: This new cleaning product works like a charm.
meaning list.sentence translation: Dette nye rengøringsprodukt fungerer perfekt.

meaning list.meaning: Jeg ville aldrig gøre eller være i en situation (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: I wouldn’t be caught dead wearing that outfit.
meaning list.sentence translation: Jeg ville aldrig have det outfit på.

meaning list.meaning: Gentagne gange, år efter år, i årevis (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: They visit the same beach year in, year out.
meaning list.sentence translation: De besøger den samme strand hvert år.

meaning list.sentence: He’s too yellow-bellied to confront his boss.
meaning list.sentence translation: Han er for meget af en kujon til at konfrontere sin chef.

word: you can't teach an old dog new tricks
phonetic american: juː kænt tiːʧ ən oʊld dɔːɡ nuː trɪks
phonetic british: juː kɑːnt tiːʧ ən əʊld dɒɡ njuː trɪks

meaning list.meaning: Det er svært at ændre nogen med gamle vaner (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He refuses to learn how to use a smartphone; you can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
meaning list.sentence translation: Han nægter at lære at bruge en smartphone; Det er svært at ændre gamle vaner.

word: your guess is as good as mine
phonetic american: jʊr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn
phonetic british: jɔːr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn

meaning list.meaning: Jeg ved det heller ikke, begge vores gæt kan være lige præcise (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: Why the train is late? Your guess is as good as mine.
meaning list.sentence translation: Hvorfor kom toget for sent? Jeg ved det heller ikke.
